thread.title: Hunt for brother of man killed at Melbourne shopping centre - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Hunt for brother of man killed at Melbourne shopping centre - Yahoo7

author: Agencies On February
title: Hunt for brother of man killed at Melbourne shopping centre - Yahoo7
text:
Share Hunt for brother of man killed at Melbourne shopping centre - Yahoo7 Police are searching for 39-year-old Seymour man Jonathan Dick after his brother David was brutally murdered at a Melbourne shopping centre. Close Victim's brother named as 'person of interest' UP NEXT VIDEO Police have revealed the identity of a man they're hunting over the murder of a Melbourne man. Source: 7 News Victim's brother named as 'person of interest' 
David, 36, was hit in the head with a long-edged blade, as he stepped out of a car park lift at Westfield Doncaster shopping centre on his way to work, at 6am last Friday. 
Police have been scouring CCTV footage of the attack and have released a picture of Jonathan who they have said is a person of interest in the investigation of his brother's death. Detectives are keen to speak to Jonathan Dick (pictured) the brother of David Dick who died following a serious assault in Doncaster last Friday. Police say he has cut his hair recently. Source: Victoria Police Murder victim David Dick. Source: 7 News 
Members of a fitness group found David badly bleeding near the car park lift lobby and attempted to help, but he was unable to be revived and died soon after. 
A witness said the man's throat was slashed, but police have only confirmed David suffered "serious head injuries". 
The footage released by police shows a man carrying a case believed to contain the long blade weapon, a day before the attack, entering a lift at the shopping centre. 
He was also seen near the car parks of the centre around the time of the attack. 
Detectives don't know what motivated the killing, but said the suspect in the video targeted David days before his murder. 
“He’s watching David come into the elevator and come up in the elevator,” Inspector Michael Hughes told the media on Tuesday. The man police say murdered Mr Dick. Source: 7 News 
“He positions himself to attack him and he hits him pretty hard the second he comes out.” 
“The person loitering on the Thursday is the person who attacked David,” Insp Hughes said. 
Police believe the killer might have also been injured and sought medical attention. 
Jonathan left his Seymour home a number of days ago and has not been contactable since. His uncle reported him missing on Monday and police are seeking assistance in locating him. 
The person of interest may be driving one of two vehicles, a 1997 blue Ford Fairmont sedan registration ONV 954 or a white 2002 Ford Falcon station wagon registration RIL 435. Jonathan may be driving one of two vehicles: a 1997 blue Ford Fairmont sedan registration ONV 954 or a white 2002 Ford Falcon station wagon registration RIL 435, similar to these cars pictured. Source: Victoria Police 
It is believed he may be headed interstate, possibly NSW or Queensland. 
Police said Jonathan had a history of spontaneously driving off to Queensland to visit his father before he died about six months ago. 
NSW Police have been notified, as the man has relatives in the state and could be headed there. 
“Were asking Jonathan if he does see the media to contact police, contact Crime stoppers or triple-0 and we will make ourselves available wherever he is,” Insp Hughes told media on Wednesday. 
There are concerns for Jonathan's safety as he has a recently-diagnosed medical condition and chose not to take medication. The public has been advised not to approach him if he is spotted, but to call triple-0. 
It is understood the victim's distraught family did not recognise the man in the video ahead of Tuesday's press conference. 
Anyone with information is encouraged to call Crime Stoppers 1800 333 000 or use the Crime Stoppers online reporting page . Close Hunt for brother of man killed at Melbourne shopping centre UP NEXT
